jurisdiction.title: Laurent Clerc National Deaf Education Center and California School for the Deaf-Fremont

FB39A66097F54C1B8311A08DFF644195.description:
Recognize that some words are fingerspelled due to
domain-specific definition.

A289AF7E7BAF4EB587318E3791BDFB00.description:
Use signs compounded with signs and lexicalized
fingerspelling.

A84C063B2B074690AE70E045290A1E9E.description:
Know and apply grade-level parameters and sign analysis skills
in decoding signs both in isolation and in context.

27B2930599E34C3591E65D5BF317503F.description:
Connect initialized forms and alphabet letters to their
equivalent in English.

5F243CA7726D47A9A22B0A26E9810F3A.description:
Demonstrate understanding of initialized and lexicalized forms
of fingerspelled words.

534F0C84B1D4475C926CFAF756B86341.description: Use fingerspelled words when there are no sign equivalents.

1BE433D55CB54FC3A0814A602AE9BF7E.description:
Use fingerspelled words for emphasis though pacing,
chunking, and/or spatial (e.g., comparing and contrasting
two ideas using two different spaces R-I-C-H in upper
right corner with P-O-O-R and use that as an established
reference).

660FD0CFCBB94923BB278F0571B48540.description:
Understand that fingerspelling is used for various purposes,
formally and informally.

204CB6170273403283227470E8C8130B.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general
academic and domain-specific signs, fingerspelled words,
and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering
signs, fingerspelled words, or phrases important to
comprehension or expression.

3990B8A1E33B46769F22811F8654178F.description:
Distinguish among connotations (associations) of signs
with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., POLITE, WITHMANNERS, FORMAL, DIPLOMATIC).

875B72D8E74F4940A7D3FC422C552DA6.description:
Use relationships between particular concepts/signs (e.g.,
cause/effect, part/whole, item/category, synonym/antonym,
analogy) to better understand each sign.

33865CB7084D4F0C8021EE4ED2BFC55A.description:
Interpret figurative language in context (e.g., personification,
allusions, irony, and puns).

746978E33C054FFB84CD6A39E82A38AB.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, sign
relationships, and nuances in sign meanings

93160737C8964547BC9A8D53498E484E.description:
Verify the meaning of a sign, depiction, or phrase (e.g.,
by checking the inferred meaning in context or other
accessible resource).

570439A133F44922B06E0F678ADD9771.description:
Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g.,
general dictionaries and content-specific references), both
print and digital, to determine and clarify its meaning.

AA90F41890E94974BF6504B41312635D.description:
Use context (e.g., cause/effect relationships and
comparisons in text) as a clue to the meaning of a sign,
fingerspelled word, classifier, or phrase.

DAD93CD64927409C8651F323EE19D315.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiplemeaning signs, fingerspelled words, spatial use, and phrases
based on grade 6 viewing and content, choosing flexibly from
a range of strategies.

B740DB300C764943893BA83C5229CC84.description:
Recognize variations from standard ASL in their own and
others’ signing and identify and use strategies to improve
expression in conventional language.

6AA0A5C590774A08A5B0047F498717B5.description:
Vary sentence patterns for meaning, viewer interest, and
style.

340732A4494348649DC43CC7B5217D2B.description:
Use knowledge of language and its structure when signing
and viewing (live and published).

ADF0F4903533433CBFC0787038CBBCFA.description:
Demonstrate command of the standard ASL grammar and
usage when signing (live and published).

FFABE035A7454214B9EB75A421341CE1.description:
Adapt signs to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating
command of formal ASL when indicated or appropriate. (See
grade 6 Language for specific expectations.)

DE8B296980CE4914908AF4FEAAD93872.description:
Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, images) and
visual displays in presentations to clarify information.

7281CBAFB19E426B9BAF566C7EB27024.description:
Present claims and findings, sequencing ideas logically and
using pertinent descriptions, facts, and details to accentuate
main ideas or themes; use appropriate eye contact,
appropriate signing space, and clear production.

ED62E14B6D0646ACB44AA034FDFAF584.description:
Delineate a signer’s argument and specific claims,
distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and
evidence from claims that are not.

69594869F2FF473F96037D0353CE1A00.description:
Interpret information presented in diverse media and formats
(e.g., visually, quantitatively) and explain how it contributes to
a topic, text, or issue under study.

3328F6EA536444ACB23A605274EA726A.description:
Review the key ideas expressed and demonstrate
understanding of multiple perspectives through reflection
and paraphrasing.

E9E4BB93E1C94FD5B9F4766467654E60.description:
Pose and respond to specific questions with elaboration and
detail by making comments that contribute to the topic,
text, or issue under discussion.

14EE211206E24B80BC804FFE912BABC0.description:
Follow rules for collegial discussions, set specific goals and
deadlines, and define individual roles as needed.

77F4947ECE0B43C396464F1D0DA31078.description:
Come to discussions prepared, having viewed or studied
required material; explicitly draw on that preparation by
referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe
and reflect on ideas under discussion.

734C4892A4AD4F42948C6FB6AB5D05FE.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (e.g.,
one-on-one, in groups, teacher-led) with diverse partners on
grade 6 topics, texts, and issues, building on others’ ideas and
expressing their own clearly.

8053EC4326514B1E8050D53FAE990B27.description:
Sign routinely over extended time frames (e.g., time for
research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames
(e.g., a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of disciplinespecific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

ECE1AD3A1BB44DC6923205FC13666919.description:
Apply grade 6 Viewing standards to literary nonfiction (e.g.,
“Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a
text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons
and evidence from claims that are not.”)

5C308170F7CB4EC7B9FA47591F2E2C63.description:
Apply grade 6 Viewing standards to literature (e.g.,
“Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres
[e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and fantasy
stories] in terms of their approaches to similar themes and
topics.”).

DF08160412DC4792A0BE7CB162B6FFD3.description:
Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support
analysis, reflection, and research.

69504E0B0FA54B5096381FE4B30A4923.description:
Gather relevant information from multiple published and
digital sources; assess the credibility of each source; and
quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others
while avoiding plagiarism and providing basic bibliographic
information for sources.

7C6F2C9233A740709FE90FDC84A70A40.description:
Conduct short research projects to answer a question,
drawing on several sources and refocusing the inquiry when
appropriate.

A8DA9E4185A6431EA76ADE4F98DF61D3.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

289F8C55178F468BB31CAB5248F3D2E3.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish
signing as well as to interact and collaborate with others;
demonstrate sufficient command of video editing skills to
compose a minimum of four minutes of video)

CF189B6BEFEA4D259436DB6E84670F2D.description:
With some guidance and support from peers and adults,
develop and strengthen signing as needed by planning,
revising, editing, re-signing, or trying a new approach. (Editing
for structure should demonstrate command of Language
standards 1-3.)

6216E5F33F354C4AABA79ACEE0F58F5C.description:
Produce clear and coherent signing in which the development,
organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and
audience. (Grade-specific expectations for signing types are
defined in standards 1-3 above.)

63B9BFD7A9304A2BAB0726DBCD6FF01E.description: Production and Distribution of Published Signing

E07DA4AB331F4347B2D1070979080C9A.description:
Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated
experiences or events.

868B57E783394791A8F18B460942A7F5.description:
Use precise signs, depiction, and phrases, relevant
descriptive details, and sensory language to convey
experiences and events.

D93D173EE6B04A70892CE18C60890E61.description:
Use a variety of transition signs, phrases, and clauses to
convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or
setting to another.d. Provide a sense of closure.

21AF82507DDE40629A7A86C6CE97EB0C.description:
Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and
description, to develop experiences, events, and/or
characters.

D41ADE80339E4093B2BC18D0A6A5CE16.description:
Engage and orient the viewer by establishing a context and
introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event
sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.

1105586BDAEC4DEBA247FC706F1D1035.description:
Sign narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or
events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details,
and well-structured event sequences.

3986DDDC7C2B4503A4D877922A9FF8BF.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

A1B1E1DC48A5451BB52570D9CE41B584.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from
the information or explanation presented.

FD2CF308996743819B77EC8064BFE53A.description:
Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to
inform about or explain the topic.

6F1D734A376C4815BBCDEC3E90D7AED8.description:
Use appropriate transitions to clarify the relationships among
ideas and concepts.

4E86D1DFC4A345678BA42AEDD7DE0D2C.description:
Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete
details, quotations, or other information and examples.

6B784415466942E59B180F49D282F4B9.description:
Introduce a topic; organize ideas, concepts, and information,
using strategies such as definition, classification,
comparison/contrast, and cause/effect; include formatting
(e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and
multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

E9AB721BC065420B908C43993DBB01CE.description:
Sign informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and
convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection,
organization, and analysis of relevant content.

DAD0289CCF384FC481515952C3D6D355.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

931C0B4F4DD9453CA4B6AD31CE3F15F7.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from
the argument presented.

9A808688F40546218F0E00ED63402479.description:
Support claim(s) with clear reasons and relevant evidence,
using credible sources and demonstrating an understanding
of the topic or text.

A17DE0B7DD564FCBB9B704210D70ADD7.description:
Introduce claim(s) and organize the reasons and evidence
clearly.

25165A48935B4FF389B8A2FC09770F65.description:
Sign arguments to support claims with clear reasons and
relevant evidence.

8F41136762AE485DB25CF6258E4F9E7A.description:
By the end of the year, view and comprehend literary
nonfiction in the grades 6-8 text complexity band proficiently,
with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

CE6308336F8347BDA09D3AB145CA536F.description: Range of Viewing and Level of Text Complexity

25FAFF02F990460B91743B83653FF984.description:
Compare and contrast one author’s presentation of events
with that of another (e.g., a memoir signed by and a biography
on the same person).

2E33A5101A394EFA928170DF7C4BE74B.description:
Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a
text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and
evidence from claims that are not.

6BA9B3942C6C4C7FA975171A79547AE6.description:
Integrate information presented in different media or formats
(e.g., visually, quantitatively) as well as in signs to develop a
coherent understanding of a topic or issue.

90BA8F80219646A9BCCE0DB30D204CC9.description:
Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and
explain how it is conveyed in the text.

9C1E1F90B4C3480BAB31563840537AC6.description:
Analyze how a particular sentence, paragraph, chapter, or
section fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes
to the development of the ideas.

75F87F92E17641FAB73069B65F3F1774.description:
Determine the meaning of signs and phrases as they are
used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical
meanings choice on meaning and tone.

E4C9BA908666406E98EFD4BB85CB3BC3.description:
Analyze in detail how a key individual, event, or idea is
introduced, illustrated, and elaborated in a text (e.g., through
examples or anecdotes).

F2B3A1C50BBC427688C10A7EFF4C5FA0.description:
Determine a central idea of a text and how it is conveyed
through particular details; provide a summary of the text
distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

86426D3C8B6B429CA2DDA95EFB0E1FB8.description:
Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says
explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

6AC42C00EB684874A6F3816F016BD838.description:
By the end of the year, view and comprehend literature,
including stories, dramas, and poems, in the grades 6-8 text
complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at
the high end of the range.

C0E20E570A9A4382924B627A7A3EC0F8.description: Range of Viewing and Level of Text Complexity

DFDFAD56B2FE41AD89BE70C624BFA7B1.description:
Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres (e.g.,
stories and poems; historical novels and fantasy stories) in
terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics.

5312E099FCC043908175DCECBC3F5CA8.description:
Compare and contrast the experience of viewing a story,
drama, or poem to viewing a video or live version of the text,
including contrasting what they “see” when they view the text
to what they perceive when they attend or watch.

BC518D47177A425D8CCB82BD2DA26BC8.description:
Explain how an author develops the point of view of the
narrator or signer in a text.

41910B98963C48D3B9C079C01D5B0480.description:
Analyze how a particular sentence, chapter, scene, or stanza
fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the
development of the theme, setting, or plot.

48C41009A6B045D5A5E10830CD9DFFB8.description:
Determine the meaning of signs and phrases as they are used
in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings;
analyze the impact of a specific sign choice on meaning and
tone.

6CB18866E80C419DB7895480AFE824B4.description:
Describe how a particular story’s or drama’s plot unfolds in a
series of episodes as well as how the characters respond or
change as the plot moves toward a resolution.

59252592F6DC419C93B7BB6D610E6465.description:
Determine a theme or central idea of a text and how it is
conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the
text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

4D3B5EF3BA9B4E12B11B33CE67C7646E.description:
Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says
explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.
